com.vaadin.contrib.gwtgraphics.client
Interface Positionable

All Known Implementing Classes:
Circle, Ellipse, Image, Path, Rectangle, Shape, Text
public interface Positionable

A class implementing this interface can be positioned by setting the x and y coordinates.

Author:
Henri Kerola / IT Mill Ltd

Method Summary
 int getX()
          Returns the x-coordinate position of the element.
 int getY()
          Returns the y-coordinate position of the element.
 void setX(int x)
          Sets the x-coordinate position of the element.
 void setY(int y)
          Sets the y-coordinate position of the element.
 

Method Detail

getX

int getX()
Returns the x-coordinate position of the element.

Returns:
the x-coordinate position in pixels

setX

void setX(int x)
Sets the x-coordinate position of the element.

Parameters:
x - the new x-coordinate position in pixels

getY

int getY()
Returns the y-coordinate position of the element.

Returns:
the y-coordinate position in pixels

setY

void setY(int y)
Sets the y-coordinate position of the element.

Parameters:
y - the new y-coordinate position in pixels
